item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“‘Today’s ruling is a very strong statement that the entire prosecution is flawed,’ said attorney Adam Frank, who is representing Lucero.

According to Frank, Judge Kirby also said Thursday that if he had been presented with the protesters’ arrest warrants he would not have signed them, signaling the judge did not believe there was probable cause for any of the charges.”

An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.

thedenverchannel.com

Judge throws out attempted-kidnapping charges against Aurora protest leaders

An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“An Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles leading an Elijah McClain protest last summer outside an Aurora police precinct.

In a rare ruling, Judge Leroy Kirby dismissed the Class 3 felony charges against Lillian House, 26, Whitney Lucero, 23, and Joel Northam, 33, following a preliminary hearing that took place March 9 and 16.

Preliminary hearings are... conducted to determine whether there is probable cause to support serious charges, and the standard prosecutors must meet is lower than at a trial. In most cases, judges find there is sufficient evidence to proceed to trial.

“Today’s ruling is a very strong statement that the entire prosecution is flawed,” said attorney Adam Frank, who is representing Lucero.

According to Frank, Judge Kirby also said Thursday that if he had been presented with the protesters’ arrest warrants he would not have signed them, signaling the judge did not believe there was probable cause for any of the charges.”

See MoreAn Adams County judge threw out attempted-kidnapping charges Thursday against three members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who were arrested for their roles in an Elijah McClain protest …

denverpost.com

item.title: HUGE VICTORY!!! Tune in tonight for an update from Joel,...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

HUGE VICTORY!!! Tune in tonight for an update from Joel, Lillian, and Eliza Live Post-Hearing Update from Targeted Denver Organizers

National Committee for Justice in Denver

MAJOR VICTORY: Judge finds no probable cause for trying Lillian House, Joel Northam, and Eliza Lucero with attempted kidnapping for July 3 protest at Aurora Police District 1 Station, dismisses charge!!! Statement coming soon
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Tune in tomorrow for this important update from Joel Northam,...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Tune in tomorrow for this important update from Joel Northam, Lillian House, and Eliza Lucero on the results of their preliminary hearing, how they are doing, and what lies ahead for them in this case. Live Post-Hearing Update from Targeted Denver Organizers

National Committee for Justice in Denver

TOMORROW | Hear a live update from Joel, Eliza, and Lillian on the results of their preliminary hearing, how they are doing, and what lies ahead for them in thi...s case. RSVP & share: Live Post-Hearing Update from Targeted Denver Organizers

••••••••••••

Six months after the surprise arrests and jailing of peaceful protest leaders Lillian House, Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero, and Terrance Roberts, the activists are in pre-trial hearings. While Elijah McClain’s killers still have faced no consequences, the activists who led the mass peaceful protest movement for justice are being dragged through a grotesque political prosecution that, if successful, could put them behind bars for as many as 48 years.

Lillian, Joel, and Eliza were in court March 9 and 22 for a preliminary hearing in which the prosecution argued that it has met the minimum legal threshold for the attempted kidnapping charge to go forward to trial. They have been hit with this absurd charge, which alone could carry over a decade in prison, for peacefully protesting outside an Aurora Police station. This Thursday morning, Judge Leroy Kirby will issue his decision, determining whether these activists will have to battle this outrageous charge at trial or whether it will be dismissed now. (The decision relates only to this single charge. They have been charged with dozens of felonies and misdemeanors related to every single peaceful protest for Elijah McClain they held over the summer.)

Please tune in Thursday evening at 5pm MT when we are grateful to have Joel, Eliza, and Lillian joining us to give a live update on the results of the hearing, how they are doing, and what lies ahead.

See More

item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Join us tonight for another Breaking the Chains study group! We will be discussing imperialism, its impacts on women, and women's resistance to it around the globe.

See you at 6pm at bit.ly/BTC323! Imperialism is a Women's Issue! Breaking the Chains Study Group

Derek Chauvin was involved in 4 killings prior to the murder of George Floyd, and had kneeled on the necks of 6 other individuals. Thanks to the research of Com...munities United Against Police Brutality we know the true extent of Chauvin's brutal record as a law enforcement officer, which includes 26 reported incidents of police misconduct.

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+3Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSLAtlanta takes to the streets against racism and...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+3Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Atlanta takes to the streets against racism and misogyny! Protests are being called across the country for a National Day of Action on 3/27!

The alarming rise i...n hate crimes over the past year correlates to an increasingly hostile U.S. foreign policy towards China. The opportunistic scapegoating of China during the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, coupled with the intensity by which China is deemed the enemy and adversary of the United States, has driven a widespread Sinophobic sentiment nationally. The Asian American community suffers the brunt of the hatred fomented as a weapon of war. To date, there have been 3,800 self-reported hate crimes against Asian Americans.

The mainstream media’s failure to label the Atlanta shooting as a hate crime demonstrates the gross disregard and injustice that our communities are facing. Racism is a sick symptom of a system that profits from war and violence.

Join us in demanding an end to anti-Asian racist violence, an end to violence against women and and end to white supremacy now! Solidarity with Asian Communities, Fight Racism!

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSLNEW STATEMENT. On Tuesday, March 16 at around 5:00...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

NEW STATEMENT.

On Tuesday, March 16 at around 5:00 p.m., three spas staffed by Asian workers in the Atlanta area were the targets of a racist and sexist mass sh...ooting. Eight people were killed, seven of whom were women, and six of the women were Asian. The shooter, a 21 year old white male, admitted to this heinous crime shortly after he was arrested later that night. Atlanta residents and Asian Americans across the country are horrified by this egregious act of terror.

The Party for Socialism and Liberation extends heart-felt condolences and solidarity to all the victims and families of this despicable massacre. Anti-Asian and anti-women bigotry is a symptom of the capitalist and imperialist system. Unity and justice requires a commitment to fighting for a new system.

As of this writing, local authorities and mainstream media refuse to label this as a hate crime. Four of the victims were of Korean descent, and according to a South Korean news site Chosun, the shooter was heard saying “I’m going to kill all Asians.”

The alarming rise of white supremacy and fascism cannot be overstated. Nearly three out of every four mass shootings can be linked back to right wing extremism. Contrary to the misleading trope of Asian-Black conflict, community organizers have rejected this attempt to divide Black and Asian communities. We understand that the inextricable link between white supremacy, patriarchy, racism and the war drive is the root cause of this violent atrocity.

We cannot make sense of this mass shooting without understanding the imperialist, sexist, and racist context in which we currently live. The shooter himself admits his fantasy of “eliminating [sexual] temptation” from places he frequented, which reveals the deeply misogynistic character of this crime. For the sake of argument, even if the shooter does not admit to his racist motives — is the mass killing of women not a hate crime? Nearly half of all female homicides in the United States are committed by an intimate partner. The hyper-militarized patriarchal culture and violence against women is woven into the fabric of this brutal system. This speaks to the century old fetishization and hyper-sexualization of Asian women not only here in the United States, but globally. Women of colonized nations such as Korea, China, Phillipines, Vietnam, etc. have historically been trafficked for sexual slavery during wartime, commonly known as “comfort women.”

This mass murder takes place during an upsurge in anti-Asian violence. Since COVID-19 was first discovered in December of 2019, hate crimes against Asian Americans rose exponentially due to the racist anti-China blame game which the corporate media and the Trump administration weaponized to deflect the gross mismanagement of the crisis here at home. To date, 3,800 self-reported hate crimes against Asian Americans have been documented. The outrage righteously felt by the Asian American community against this violence has spotlighted the issue nationally.

Over the last decade, U.S. foreign policy under the Obama Administration has shifted its military resources and focus towards Asia. The increasingly aggressive policy targets China as the ultimate adversary and competitor of the United States. Anti-China propaganda, which fuels intense hatred and racism against Chinese Americans and as a consequence Asian Americans, is designed to justify confrontation and potentially war with China. The propaganda drive was restarted under the Obama Administration and has only intensified with Trump’s racist bigotry. The solution to ending racism against Asian Americans must involve the end of the imperialist war agenda against China.

With the election of Joe Biden and a new administration many hoped that the country would turn to a new chapter. The Biden administration publicly condemned anti-Asian hate crimes, but these gestures ring hollow so long as members of his administration intensify the war drive and contribute to anti-China fear mongering.

We send our deepest sympathies to the families of the victims of this crime and to the Asian American community. We will not let the victims of this murderous crime die in vain. We will continue to organize against the dangerous cold-war against China and against racist and sexist bigotry.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: 8 people were murdered in the Atlanta area on the night of March...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

8 people were murdered in the Atlanta area on the night of March 16 when a white supremacist carried out a series of terrorist attacks targeting spas staffed by Asian workers. The Party for Socialism and Liberation expresses our deepest sympathy and solidarity to the loved ones of those who lost their lives in these horrific massacres.

The following article was originally published March 7, and analyzes the roots of the wave of anti-Asian hate sweeping the country. https://www.liberationnews.org/why-are-hate-crimes-against…/
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID! We demand that Governor Tom Wolf...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID! We demand that Governor Tom Wolf Larry Krasner for DA Pennsylvania Department of Corrections provide Mumia IMMEDIATE hospital care & issue his release NOW! Barring Mumia from medical attention & his FREEDOM is a human rights atrocity and a public health catastrophe. We demand justice and will not stand for anything less!

Take action NOW by calling PA Governor Tom Wolf's office EVERY DAY at (717) 787-2500 to demand humane treatment and compassionate ...release of Mumia Abu-Jamal, a political prisoner with COVID19 and pre-existing conditions. The time to release all aging and ill prisoners is NOW.

➡️ Phone script in comments

#FreeMumia #FreeEmAll #COVID19 #FreeAllPoliticalPrisoners

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in DenverToday Lillian House, Joel Northam and Eliza Lucero head...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in Denver

Today Lillian House, Joel Northam and Eliza Lucero head to preliminary hearing.

The officers who killed Elijah McClain walk free while the activists who demande...d justice must defend their rights in court. They face as many as 48 years in prison for leading peaceful protests for justice for Elijah McClain. The most extreme charges they face come from the same district attorney who let Elijah’s killers walk.

#DroptheChargesCO

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: "There are still separate justice systems in America,"...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"There are still separate justice systems in America," says the Root.

"The officers involved in [Elijah] McClain’s fatal arrest—Nathan Woodyard, Jason Rosenblatt and Randy Roedema—are still employed with the Aurora Police Department, after former Adams County District Attorney Dave Young said they did not break the law in their use of force against McClain. Protests against the lack of accountability for the cops went into overdrive in Aurora last summer amidst the nationwide... outrage against police brutality, especially when it came to light that police officers there had taken mocking selfies outside of a memorial to McClain.

Now several of the organizers who led those protests are potentially facing decades in prison on a suite of charges filed by Young before he left office.

“I think about the fact that we’ve done more jail time and have faced more consequences just for asking for justice for a man who we saw murdered on video, than any of the cops,” said Northam."

See MoreThere are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.

theroot.com

Elijah McClain Organizers Facing Attempted Kidnapping Charges and Decades of Prison Time for Protesting Aurora, Colo., Police

There are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.There are still separate justice systems in America, as has been evidenced by the continuing dearth of criminal consequences for police officers who’ve caused the death of numerous Americans—even in light of last year’s uprisings against high-profile cases of police violence.

item.title: While Colorado’s billionaires have made billions more, the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

While Colorado’s billionaires have made billions more, the rest of us are in the middle of an economic crisis. As food banks run out of food, a third of us can’t afford to eat. A third of renters are at risk of eviction. Many of us can’t afford diapers for our children. Our state and federal government have given us crumbs in the face of these humanitarian crises.

We live in the richest country history has ever seen, yet we are left to starve in the cold while a select few hoard more and more wealth. The rich and their politicians in Colorado and across the country are waging a war on the working people of this country, and we have to organize to fight back. Join us as we demand the cancellation of rents and mortgages, and a right to food, housing, a job, and healthcare!
https://www.denverpost.com/…/covid-colorado-economic-inequ…/

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.

denverpost.com

As job, housing and pay inequalities worsen, Coloradans say mantra to “build back stronger” rings hollow

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.

item.title: Watch the powerful short documentary film about the activists...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Watch the powerful short documentary film about the activists facing decades in prison for leading peaceful protests for #JusticeforElijahMcClain

Visit DenverDefense.org to donate, sign the petition to #DroptheChargesCO, and learn how else you can support.

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.

Watch our documentary 'In Defense of Justice in Denver' Now:

#JusticeForElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO
